tool.name: Setup PhyloPhlAn Database
tool.description: format multi-fasta file or download UniRef90 proteins
tool.command:
#import re
phylophlan_setup_database -o database
#if $action.select == "d" -g $action.g && mv database/${action.g}.faa database/${action.g}.fasta #else if $action.select == "f" -i $action.i -x fasta -d ${re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', str($action.i.element_identifier))} #end if

param.label: Taxonomic Label
param.help: The label should have the format s__<species_name>

data.name: output
data.label: ${'Format multi-fasta file on ' + $on_string if $action.select=='f' else 'Download UniRef90'}

tool.help: The phylophlan_setup_database.py script can be used to either format an input folder or multi-fasta file to be used as database in phylophlan.py, or automatically download a pre-identified set of core UniRef90 proteins for the taxonomic label of a given species.
